text: foreign
[Music]
Bob Mills Furniture our entire server
environment the environment that runs
the entire company runs out of a closet
here in Oklahoma City it's not tornado
prepared it's not storm proofed and it
doesn't even have a backup generator to
run the environment all of our offices
all of our stores and our distribution
center that runs in Fort Worth Texas all
of those depend on the servers that are
housed here in Oklahoma City without the
servers up here we can't sell furniture
at any location and we can't deliver the
furniture to our customers when they
need it when we manage servers at this
point we found that servers in the AWS
environment actually with the same specs
they actually perform better for our
users we downgraded and CPU and Ram from
a virtual environment here to AWS and we
found that that server actually performs
better and faster for our users in AWS
the additional backup environment in AWS
snapshots Etc and scripting have allowed
us to perform automated maintenance at
night so that the servers are up for
users during the day
this allows our team to run leaner and
more efficient for the company my team
can innovate and drive change versus
replacing hard drives at night and it
allows me to run with more generalists
and not having to have that specialist
it's a challenge to find for fiber
engineers and sand engineers
AWS has allowed us to innovate and stay
ahead of the curve instead of worrying
about Hardware on-premise Hardware
failures Furniture is a fantastic
industry and customers want their
products sooner they want to see more
options AWS has allowed our engineers
and our team to focus on making the
environment better for them versus
managing a legacy on-prem Hardware
environment
